fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the Issue Collector is set to use a Custom Template, the Template Preview shows blank.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Issue Collector using a Custom Template

h3. Expected Results
Once you open the issue collector in the Issue Collectors page, the Template Preview should show the template of the Issue Collector

h3. Actual Results
The Template Preview is blank:
!Screen Shot 2017-11-23 at 11.47.56.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Editing the Issue Collector shows the Template of the Issue Collector
fields.summary: Issue Collector using Custom Template, shows the Template Preview blank

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira creates issues without Priority if the Priority field is Hidden in Field Configuration
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove the _Priority_ field from the screen
 # In the Field configuration, click _Hide_ next to the _Priority_ field
 # Create a test issue

If you revert this and show the Priority field in the Field configuration, then, when you prompt to add a Priority, it won't respect the *Default* priority. Steps to reproduce this.
 # Remove the _Priority_ field from the screen
 # In the Field configuration, click _Hide_ next to the _Priority_ field
 # Create a test issue
 # In the Field configuration, click _Show_ next to the _Priority_ field
 # In your workflow, associate a screen with a transition
 # In the screen of step 5, add the Priority field
 # In your test issue created in step 3, transition it in order to trigger the screen of step 5
 # You will notice the "suggested" Priority will be the first one of the Priorities list, instead of the default

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be created with the default Priority
h3. Actual Results

The issue is being created without Priority
h3. Notes

"Where is my field" says
_The field 'Priority' does not have value for issue DSSP-9 and will not be displayed on the view issue page. Set value for that field so that it shows up._
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Jira creates issues without Priority if the Priority field is Hidden in Field Configuration

fields.description:
*Summary*

When the Reopened status is renamed to another name and it is included in the workflow, the activity stream will recognize the status still as *Reopened* and update the activity stream with: _User X reopened Issue-Key: 40_ when the it should show: _User X changed the status to Production Sample on Issue-Key: 40_.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 1. Go to the statuses page > Rename the Reopened status to something else
 2. Open an existing workflow > Copy the workflow 
 3. In the copied workflow > Remove the previous status and insert the renamed Reopened Status within it
 4. Add a Scheme to the Workflow > Update the project with the newly modified workflow
 5. Proceed to transition the issue to the newly renamed Reopened Status
 !reopen1.png|width=586,height=245!
 6. Check the Activity Stream > It will show: _User X reopened Issue-Key: 40_
 _!reopen2.png|width=556,height=126!_

*Expected Results*

The activity stream should reflect the _User X changed the status to Production Sample on Issue-Key: 40_.

*Actual Results*

Still shows the Reopened status activity update: _User X reopened Issue-Key: 40_

*Workaround*
 # Rename the Status with id=4 that show reopened in the Activity Stream back to Reopened. 
 # Create a new status with the desired correct status name.
 # Copy the existing workflow > Edit the workflow remove the renamed reopened status and put in the newly created status
 # Replace the workflow and make it the new active workflow > Ensure all the transitions are correct
 # The activity stream will update correctly now.
fields.summary: Activity Stream Updates Incorrectly When Using Renamed Reopened Status

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Once you estimate an issue and log work on it, a system field 'Progress' calculates the percentage of the issue progress based on the estimation and the logged works. This 'Progress' field isn't exported to CSV even when selecting 'All Fields' to be exported

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log work on an issue
# Export that issue to CSV with All Fields

h3. Expected Results
The field 'Progress' should be exported as well

h3. Actual Results
The field 'Progress' isn't exported

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Unable to Export 'Progress' field to CSV

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Currently, in JIRA issue view, it is not possible to hide the tabs at the bottom such as Comments, Work log, History.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Have an option to hide the tabs at the bottom such as Comments, Work log, History.
fields.summary: Have an option to hide/disable tabs in JIRA issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever an issue security is set to Group(anyone) the issue is still not visible to anyone.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Issue security and grant access to Group(anyone).
# Set the Browse project permission to Group(anyone) for the project 
# Try accessing the project in incognito mode (Without being logged in)

h3. Expected Results

Anonymous users should be able to access All issue present in the Project including those having the issue security granted to Group(Anyone).

h3. Actual Results
The issues that Group(anyone) has been issue security access to are not accessible.
fields.summary: Issue security does not work when set to Group(anyone)

fields.description:
If user have different userKey and userName, then they can't receive push notification.

Also they can't assign a ticket to themselves in Jira iOS app.
fields.summary: Can't receive push notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Recently, users are having issues related to the access to the Billing Details section. Specifically, the following message is displayed:

{quote}
"We can't load this page right now"
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

It's unclear what's causing the issue, but, it's confirmed to be browser related. For the affected users/instances, the following steps can be followed:
# Be sure to be part of the *site-admins* group, so the *Site Administration* content can be accessed
# Click on the *Application Navigator > Site Administration*
# Click on *Billing* on the sidebar and select any of the options (e.g. Payment Details)

h3. Expected Results
The content of the Payment Details should be loaded
h3. Actual Results
No content is loaded. Only the "We can't load this page right now" information is displayed.

h3.Workaround
From the affected users, either accessing the browser through incognito mode or making sure to clear all the cache/cookies tied to the Atlassian products.
fields.summary: Issues Accessing Billing Details

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
By default, Jira Core boards order the items from the oldest to newest by creation date. Once you have many issues in the boards, the newly created ones aren't displayed in the board

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow an option to re-order the issues on the board from the newest to the oldest by creation date.

h3. Why this is important
This is important to view the newest issues on the boards.
 
h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Allows an option to re-order the issues in Core Boards
Searching for Label Type Custom Field is not Returning Expected Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Whenever trying to search for a *Label Type Custom Field*, the expected outputs will not be returned. 

Behaviours observed:
Scenario: you have a custom field of type Label called *Label CF*. One out of 10k issues have a value set for this field.
# If you search for {{"Label CF" = "value"}}, it'll return all issues.
# If you search for {{"Label CF" IS EMPTY}}, it will not return anything.
# If you search for {{"Label CF" IS NOT EMPTY}}, it'll return all your issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *Custom Field* using Label type
# Associate it to the desired screens (e.g. View Issue Screen, Edit Issue Screen)
# Populate Custom Field with any value (e.g. "Test")
# Run a JQL that would return the issues where the custom field is populated with "Test"
{code}
"<Custom Field Name>" IS NOT EMPTY
{code}

h3. Expected Results
 * Only issues where the field is populated would be returned

h3. Actual Results
 * All issues are returned
fields.summary: Searching for Label Type Custom Field is not Returning Expected Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to attach multiple files at the same time, the first file select won't upload (the others will). Jira shows the following pop up:

!Screen Shot 2017-11-21 at 3.36.13 PM.png!

 
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on browse in the Attachment field;
 # Select more than one file and hit enter (select).

The error is intermittent, and it happens when you manually drop files too.
h3. Expected Results

It should upload all the files.
h3. Actual Results

Sometimes, the first file won't be uploaded.
h3. Workaround

Selecting one file at a time won't trigger the error. Also, another supported browsers (e.g Chrome) are working correctly with the attachment feature (see: [Supported browsers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html]).
fields.summary: Error when attaching multiples files at the same time in Safari

h3. Summary
Ctrl+V shortcut does not paste into Summary field on FireFox
h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JIRA Cloud

* choose other browser.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to log in via the latest version of Jira cloud mobile for iOS and having SAML log in integrated with Okta, customers are being redirected to Okta as expected. After entering the username and password, an error is displayed and users cannot log in.

 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your Jira mobile iOS app
 # Enter your email address to log in
 # You are redirected to OKTA where you enter your OKTA credentials
 # An error message is displayed and no log in is possible

h3. Expected Results

Users can log in as normal
h3. Actual Results 

The below error is thrown:

!IMG_1742.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes 

The issue is not reproducible on Android.
h3. Workaround 

No workaround available
fields.summary: Customers cannot login in to iOS via SAML provider OKTA

fields.description:
As a user, I'm filtering a scrum board for issues "assigned to me". I see a subtask, and I can see its issue number and the issue number of the parent task. I should be able to click the parent issue number to see its details.

Alternatively, I should be able to click the subtask, thus opening its detail view, and access the parent issue from there.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Replies or forwards via email are getting into JIRA as new issues instead of comments when there is no issue-key on the subject.
h3. Environment
 * Jira 55701f88

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a "Create a new issue or add comment to an exiting issue" mail handler set.
 # Send an email to that mail handler.
 ** JIRA will create a new issue (e.g.: AB-1).
 # Reply or forward that same email to the mail handler; however, ensure that the subject header does not contain the issue key.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should add a comment to the existing issue as it's a reply/forward to the email.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA creates a new issue.
h3. Notes

The [Creating issues and comments from email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-779288896.html] documentation states that:
{quote}
*Issue and comment creation*
The following diagram shows how Jira processes each incoming email message and determines how its content becomes a new issue or a comment on an existing issue:
{quote}
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Issue and comment creation mail handler not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The details tab of owned filters is not loading.

h3. Environment
 * JIRA 1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a filter you own or create a new one.
# Notice that the details button is missing.

h3. Expected Results
 * The details button would be rendered

h3. Actual Results
 * The details button is not rendered

h3. Workaround

# Append this to the URL placing the id filter you want to edit/secure/EditFilter!default.jspa?filterId=
# Browse *Issues* > *Manage Filters* > *My* click on *more* button (*...*) and select *Edit*


h3. Note
fields.summary: The details button of filters is not loading

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Customers need to be able to create personal access tokens into JIRA in order to create integrations or automations in JIRA with defined access disregarding the user account in use.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a similar functionality as the existing one from Bitbucket: [Personal access tokens|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/personal-access-tokens-939515499.html].
fields.summary: Ability to create Personal access tokens in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, add-on users show up as regular users in the dropdown list when mentioning in a comment, for instance.

!Screen Shot 2018-05-23 at 15.31.31.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the option to hide these users or make them hidden by default.
h3. Why this is important

Less confusing UI for customers as they could mistakenly select one of these users.
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability To Hide Add-on users from dropdown list.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Mistakenly removing a mandatory field from issue creation's screen does not show any error. 
The field needs to be at least in one of the creation screens otherwise it will cause failures in creating issues afterwards.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Identify what Field configuration schema is used by the project.
# Go to "Field configurations settings" and click on "Configure".
# Go to one of the mandatory field and click "Screens"
# Deselect all screens and update.
# Try creating an issue

h3. Expected Results 
Once clicking on update (step #4), an error/warning should prompt telling that the mandatory field needs to be at least in one of the screens to be able to create issues.

h3. Actual Results 
The field is removed from the screens and user can't create issues anymore.
fields.summary: Removing mandatory field from all screens should either be prohibited or show warnings.

fields.description:

In attachments, “me” is @admin which is incorrect. Tap on that cell causes error.

Expected
hule
fields.summary: Assign to me for Site admin does not work in Jira IOS

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Searching for issue owned by two projects does not prompt any error saying that an issue can belong to one project only

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to search for issues
# Select: *Advanced JQL*
# Enter the query: {{project=XX AND project=YYY}}

h3. Expected Results
An error message stating that this is a bad logic, an issue can only be owned by one project.

h3. Actual Results
No issues found.
fields.summary: JQL search could warn the user when conflicting criteria are found

fields.description:
As per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67110?focusedCommentId=1664949&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1664949
 
Example: On Jira Data Center it could be found if any of the attachments are missing after restore. Using the findattachments-7.jsp copy to: /opt/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira/secure/admin
Navigate to: http://URL:PORT/secure/admin/findattachments-7.jsp and press the button "Missing Attachment Report"
On this point, a user can't find if any of the attachments are missing after restoring the cloud instance.
fields.summary: Add ability to detect missing attachments

fields.description:
We need a way to have a standard set of Components for our Projects.

This ticket proposes that we be able to copy Components from Project to Project to achieve that.

The ability to copy Components seems a pretty basic requirement for general use anyhow.
fields.summary: Copy Components from Project to Project
Post function adds the same user multiple times in the same multi valued field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Jira Cloud doesn't allow admins to customize the Jira issue view page

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow admins to customize how a Jira issue is displayed e.g. allow admins to swap positions of "Share with customer" and "Comment internally" or move the comment box to the top of the screen

h3. Why this is important
* Allows greater flexibility regarding how Jira issues are displayed
 
h3. Workaround 
* None
fields.summary: Allow admins to customise the layout of the Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a Jira user I want to get notified once a group of issues is completed. So, I don't want to get notified per issue basis neither for each status change.

h3. Suggested Solution
Notify when a group of issues is completed.

h3. Why this is important
Notifying per issue basis can cause confusion for the external listener.
fields.summary: Notify when a group of issues is completed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a Jira administrator I want to see on the audit log interface when a user changes the statuses by getting through Administration > Issues > Issue Attributes > Statuses

h3. Suggested Solution
Add this entry to the logs sent to the audit log.

h3. Why this is important
This change affect all projects. 
This change can be changed by mistake and we would like to identify who did it.
 
h3. Workaround 
It is important to limit the number of users having the global permission "Jira administrators permission"
fields.summary: Audit log does not show *Issue Attributes > Statuses* change

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a Jira administrator I want to see on the audit log interface when a user changes the statuses by getting through Administration > Issues > Issue Attributes > Statuses
h3. Suggested Solution

Add this entry to the logs sent to the audit log.
h3. Why this is important

This change affect all projects. 
 This change can be changed by mistake and we would like to identify who did it.
h3.
fields.summary: Audit log does not show changes to Status details

fields.summary: Updating issue fields fails in Jira fails with exception

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, if an admin tries to edit an active workflow, it enters in draft mode. If the draft workflow is not published nor discarted, when going back to the workflow list, there will be a Tooltip on that given workflow with the phrase:

_This workflow has an unpublished draft last edited by (0) at (1)_  (changing ('s for {'s ).

h3. Suggested Solution

The phrase should show the author and date instead of (0) and (1)
_This workflow has an unpublished draft last edited by *author* at *date*_

h3. Why this is important
 
Mostly to leave things tidy, enhancing the user experience.

h3. Workaround 

Enter the workflow draft.
fields.summary: Unpublished Workflow Draft Tooltip to show author and date

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The user created post functions in workflows are swapping places without any action. Thus, issues cannot be cloned or sometimes, created.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Clone an existing issue or create a new one.

h3. Expected Results
The issue is created successfully.

h3. Actual Results
You may get an error similar to this one:
!exception.png|thumbnail! 

The actual error message may vary due to the post function, but it's related to *{{com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowException}}*

h3. Notes
This problem seems to affect post functions created by users or add-ons which were working properly and they haven't changed or edited recently.

h3.Workaround
Go to project settings and double check the workflow used in the issue type.
Take a look at the *Create* step and check its post functions. The *Creates the issue originally* must be the first post function to be triggered.
!post-functions.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Post functions in workflows are swapping places

fields.description: Customer wants to have his user added to every issues raised in the system.
fields.summary: Watcher Added to All Issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

'administrators' group must be defined as lower case. If it is deleted and recreated as 'Administrators', assigning it in the global permissions will not work

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Delete group 'administrators' (all lower case)
# Recreate group 'Administrators' (note A is the capital letter)
# Add a user to the group 'Administrators'
# Go to Application Access > View Configuration
# Add 'Administrator' group under Jira Administration
# Login as the user and try to access Jira Administration page

h3. Expected Results

User will be able to see Jira Administration page

h3. Actual Results

User cannot access Jira Administration page

h3. Workaround

Use 'administrators' group, instead of 'Administrators' group. The name must be all lowercase
fields.summary: 'administrators' group must be lowercase or else, it will not work with Global Permission

fields.description:
*Summary*

Cannot perform a bulk operation when selecting a default filter, such as _My open issues_ and _Reported by me_.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Go to *Issues > My open issues*.
 # Click on the three dots option, _Change all issue(s)_.

*Expected Results*

The screen should show an option to select the bulk change you want to perform.

*Actual Results*

Reverts back to _My open issues_ filter.

*Workaround*

Any change in the query of the filter makes it possible to perform the bulk change.  
 1. Click on the default filter
 2. Click on Save As.. 
 3. Click on The Saved Filter and proceed to perform the bulk edit normally.
fields.summary: Unable to perform any bulk operation when selecting a default filter

Cheers,
Anne Calantog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using a JQL that returns more than 1000 issues, attempting to navigate to pages until it displays 1001+ will result in the issue navigator freezing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that the JIRA instance has more than 1000 issues.
# Go to the issue navigator and run a JQL that returns more than 1000 issues.
# Navigate the pages until it will display issues *1001-xxxx of xxxx* where xxxx is the total number of issues in the projects

h3. Expected Results:
Since the limit for a search is 1000 issues, the JQL should immediately return a warning /error message and instruct the user to refine the search criteria displaying up to 1000 issues. The message should be bold with the directions to "refine search criteria". Expect the message to display the total issues number for that executed search criteria.

h3. Actual Results:
The issue navigator will return more than 1000 issues and display a count of all returned issues. Ex. 1–100 of 4029. This misleads the user to think they can page beyond 1000 issues to view all of them. And the "refine search criteria" message is faint and displayed at the very end of the 1000 issues frustrating the user because it is displayed after paging through the results and difficult to see.

h3. Notes:
Warning /error message should display immediately at the beginning of search results when the issue navigator returns more than 1000 issues.
fields.summary: When attempting to access more than 1000+ results in List view, the issue navigator will be frozen
Make the /rest/auth/1/session endpoint accept API token instead of password

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There have been a few changes on the endpoints around the backup manager which caused the script we provide customers with to fail. See [How to Automate Backups for JIRA Cloud applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-automate-backups-for-jira-cloud-applications-779160659.html].
One of the changes was that the endpoint to trigger the backup has changed from {{rest/obm/1.0/runbackup}} to {{rest/backup/1/export/runbackup}}.

The other one, which I have not been able to workaround it, is that the endpoint to get the progress on the backup creation, {{rest/backup/1/export/getprogress.json}} is now returning a 404.

Through the browser's development panel, it's been identified that the endpoint {{rest/internal/2/task/progress/<task_number>}} is now called to retrieve the backup progress. 

h3. Symptoms
# End to trigger the backup, {{/rest/obm/1.0/runbackup}}, now returns "Oops, you've found a dead link.".
# Progress check endpoint, {{/1/export/getprogress.json}}, not returns a 404.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Trigger a backup
# Run
{code}curl -D- -u <user>:<pass> -X GET https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/backup/1/export/getprogress.json{code}

h3. Expected Results
The backup progress is returned successfully.

h3. Actual Results
A 404 HTTP is returned instead.

h3. Workaround:
The {{taskId}} is returned after triggering the backup through the endpoint {{rest/backup/1/export/runbackup}}. The returned JSON looks like this:
{code}{"taskId":"10109"}{code}
Customers will need to adjust their scripts to capture the {{taskId}} accordingly.
fields.summary: Automated backup script stopped working due to recent changes on the endpoints

When exporting a single issue (Print or Word) the date fields are not converted to the timezone, they're exported using UTC.

The issue doesn't happen when exporting to XML.

*

h3. Expected Results
The dates should appear in the exported file as they are in the UI
h3. Actual Results
Depending on the time, the dates will be different because Jira won't convert to the correct timezone. For example, if the comment date appears as Oct 26th 09:00 PM for a user on GMT-6, when the issue is exported it'll appear as Oct 27th
*Application logs:*

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Date fields are not converted to the user timezone when exporting an issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

When issue are created with field values in *JIRA Server*, the fields updates are shown on history tab. However, when migrated over to Cloud, the fields are no longer showing even though there is an entries in the database ({{changeitem}} table)

Cloud defines the initial entries in the history tab by specifying the *initialgroup* as "true" in the *changegroup* table. Hence, when issue are created, the entries has the value {{initialgroup = true}} and would not render in the history tab.

h3. Suggestion
Render field values in the history tab that were entered during issue creation to see the actual value that were entered.
fields.summary: Initial field entries in history missing in Cloud when issue migrated from server

fields.description:
As a JIRA administrator and connect add-on developer, I'd like to have more information been provided when a failed attempt to install a custom add-on is made. 

Currently, when the installation fails, a generic error message is displayed and the only way to get more information about why it's failing is by contacting Atlassian Support at https://support.atlassian.com 

h5. Example: 

* Error message displayed on the UI: 

{quote}
"The add-on failed to install. Please try again later or contact the add-on vendor."
{quote}

Which gives the add-on vendor no clue what the issue is with the installation.

* Error message displayed on the instance's backend: 

{code}
Error contacting remote application 405:[Method Not Allowed]:	
    	 stack:	 com.atlassian.plugin.connect.api.lifecycle.ConnectAddonInstallException: Error contacting remote application 405:[Method Not Allowed]:
	at 
{code}


Possible ways to improve this: 
* The error message that's recorded on the instance's backend could be shared instead of the generic error message that is currently displayed on the UI.
fields.summary: UPM failure exceptions when trying to install custom add-ons could be more specific

h3. Summary
The text editor in Jira does not apply the formatting if there are hard returns in the text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Jira issue and insert a text with hard return on the comment or description section.
# Select all the text, and try to apply a formatting, for example, *bold* or _italic_

h3. Expected Results
All the text is properly formatted:
!formatted-with-return.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The editor inserts the symbol at the beginning and end of the text, but it is not formatted:
!with-hard-return.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
This behavior is also noticed in the comments.

h3.Workaround
You must surround each block of text with hard return with the desired formatting manually, for example:
{noformat}
_Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam fermentum vestibulum est. Cras rhoncus._ 
_Pellentesque habitant morbi tristique senectus et netus et malesuada fames ac turpis egestas._ 
_Sed quis tortor. Donec non ipsum. Mauris condimentum, odio nec porta tristique, ante neque malesuada massa, in dignissim eros velit at tellus. 
Donec et risus in ligula eleifend consectetur._ 
_Donec volutpat eleifend augue. Integer gravida sodales leo. Nunc vehicula neque ac erat. Vivamus non nisl. Fusce ac magna. Suspendisse euismod libero eget mauris._
{noformat}

# Transition an issue to 'In Progress'
        

h3. Expected Results

Date in Progress field is filled with the date and time in JIRA's default time zone

h3. Actual Results

Date in Progress field is filled with the date and time in GMT+0

h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: %%CURRENT_DATETIME%% in post function does not respect Time Zone set in user's profile or JIRA's default time zone

fields.description:

Shows the number of issues that match specified filters in a service desk project.
{code}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/using-dashboard-gadgets-776636252.html

Thanks

fields.description:
*Summary*

In the JIRA Mobile Android version, when clicking on edit on the comment, the new line key button does not allow the user to create a new line in the comment box, it does not respond. In other

*Environment*
 JIRA - v2.0.89 Android

*Steps to Reproduce*

  1. On a JIRA issue in the Android application, scroll down to a comment or create a comment on the issue
   2. Tap on the vertical three dotted line > Tap on *Edit* 
   3. In the edit screen, if you click on the *green button* to insert a new line in the comment equivalent to clicking enter
 !android.jpg|width=331,height=590!
   4. The button does not respond and does not create a new line in the comment.

*Expected Results*
 The comment should create a new line for the user to type the information in.

*Actual Results*
 Clicking has no effect, almost as if it's not a clickable area.
fields.summary: Android JIRA: When Editing New Line Button Does Not Work

fields.description:
*Issue*

You have a comment section in the issue page and there you have the ability to get a _Permalink_.

To do so, you need to right click on the Permalink menu item and from there you need to click on "Copy link address". You also get a tooltip message saying "Right click and copy for a permanent link to this comment."

This is a tedious feature and its not user friendly, hence the reason I'm reporting this :) 

Refer to attachment.

*Suggested Solution*

Rephrase the menu item to "Copy Permalink" and by clicking on it you get the permalink copied to clipboard. You can even assists user by a tooltip massage.
fields.summary: Getting a permalink to a comment is tedious and not user friendly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Search using the wildcard * doesn't work as expected.
h3. Customer Impact
h3. Environment

*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field type text and add it to the issues' screens
 # Create two new issues
 # Add the value 5-7599-30059 to the issue Test-1
 # Add the value 5-7599-30058 to the issue Test-2
 # Run this search - cf[xxxx] ~ 5*30059

h3. Expected Results

It should find only the issue Test-1
h3. Actual Results

It finds both issues Test-1 and Test-2
 *Application logs:*
h3. Notes

* It also happens when the search is like this: 5-75*30059
 * It also happens when the field has no hyphens (5759930059) using this search cf[xxxx] ~ 5*30059
h3. Workaround

None so far
fields.summary: Search using the wildcard * doesn't work as expected
